bibl.title: A Greek Papyrus Containing Babylonian Lunar Theory.
bibl.note: P. Coll. privées: P. Colker sans No. d'Inv. [décrit par: Otto NEUGEBAUER, A Babylonian Lunar Ephemeris from Roman Egypt, A Scientific Humanist: Studies in Memory of Abraham Sachs = Occasional Publications of the Samuel Noah Kramer Fund. 9 (Philadelphia, 1988) pp. 301-304]. Provenance unknown, late Ptolemaic period to the first half of the first century A.D. On the obverse, along the fibres, are parts of thirteen lines of a heavily abbreviated register in a first-century A.D. cursive hand.
